INSIDE SPORT PRESENTER GABBY LOGAN
Hello everyone, Gabby here.


Tonight is our last Monday show and we've been working on a very special edition of the programme. Our reporter, Garry Richardson, has been following referee Graham Poll in what has turned out to be his last season.  


You'll remember it was Poll who made one of the most public refereeing mistakes in history, giving three yellow cards to the same Croatian player at the World Cup Finals last year. 


It was not long after that error that we began to follow him. 


The really interesting thing about the documentary is that you see a very different side of Poll - he's viewed by many as an arrogant man who likes to be the centre of attention on the pitch. But we show you the other side of the man, the private side, the side that has doubts - so you can judge him for yourself.


* He relives the moment he found out he'd made that mistake at the World Cup Finals and how it motivated him to keep going.


* He gives his view of the season-long controversy between him and Chelsea manager, Jose Mourinho.


* He explains why he sent off Everton's James McFadden and how disappointed he was by Everton's repsonse.


* He gives his side of the story of when he sent off Chelsea and England captain, John Terry.


*He admits match officials made a mistake that led to a crucial goal against Charlton at Christmas last year.


*He criticises the FA for not protecting referees against players and managers enough and says much tougher action needs to be taken against those who misbehave.


* And he tells us what he was feeling just after he had refereed his last ever professional game - the play off final last Monday.


It's a gripping watch - well worth staying up for.


So join me for Inside Sport at 2305 BST, BBC ONE.



Gabby hosts Inside Sport on Monday 4 June, 2305 BST on BBC ONE, and second edition, Sunday 10 June, 1130 BST on BBC TWO.
